org.everit.osgi.dev.maven

Class DistMojo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo
      • org.everit.osgi.dev.maven.DistMojo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.maven.plugin.ContextEnabled, org.apache.maven.plugin.Mojo
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntegrationTestMojo

    @Mojo(name="dist",
      defaultPhase=PACKAGE,
      requiresProject=true,
      requiresDependencyResolution=COMPILE)
@Execute(phase=PACKAGE)
public class DistMojo
extends org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo
    Creates a distribution package for the project. Distribution packages may be provided as Environment parameters or 'equinox', the default option, -may also be used. The structure of the distribution package may be different for different types.

    • Field Detail

      • artifactFactory

        @Component
protected org.apache.maven.artifact.factory.ArtifactFactory artifactFactory

      • artifactRepositoryFactory

        @Component
protected org.apache.maven.artifact.repository.ArtifactRepositoryFactory artifactRepositoryFactory

      • artifactResolver

        @Component
protected org.apache.maven.artifact.resolver.ArtifactResolver artifactResolver

      • copyMode

        @Parameter(property="eosgi.copyMode")
protected String copyMode
        If link than the generated files in the dist folder will be links instead of real copied files. Two possible values: symbolicLink, file. In case this is an incrementel update, the default mode is the same as the mode of the previous build. In case this is a clean build, the default mode is 'file'.

      • distConfigJAXBContext

        protected final JAXBContext distConfigJAXBContext

      • distFolder

        @Parameter(property="eosgi.distFolder",
           defaultValue="${project.build.directory}/eosgi-dist")
protected String distFolder
        Path to folder where the distribution will be generated. The content of this folder will be overridden if the files with same name already exist.

      • distributedEnvironments

        protected List<DistributedEnvironment> distributedEnvironments

      • environmentId

        @Parameter(property="eosgi.environmentId",
           defaultValue="*")
protected String environmentId
        Comma separated list of the id of the environments that should be processed. Default is * that means all environments.

      • environments

        @Parameter
protected EnvironmentConfiguration[] environments
        The environments on which the tests should run.

protected List<org.apache.maven.artifact.repository.ArtifactRepository> remoteRepositories

      • reportFolder

        @Parameter(property="eosgi.testReportFolder",
           defaultValue="${project.build.directory}/eosgi-report")
protected String reportFolder
        The folder where the integration test reports will be placed. Please note that the content of this folder will be deleted before running the tests.

      • servicePort

        @Parameter(property="eosgi.servicePort")
protected String servicePort
        Comma separated list of ports of currently running OSGi containers. Such ports are normally opened with richConsole. In case this property is defined, dependency changes will be pushed via the defined ports.

      • sourceDistPath

        @Parameter(property="eosgi.sourceDistPath",
           defaultValue="${basedir}/src/dist/")
protected String sourceDistPath
        The directory where there may be additional files to create the distribution package (optional).

      • upgradePortByEnvironmentId

        protected Map<String,Integer> upgradePortByEnvironmentId

      • generateDistributableArtifacts

        protected List<DistributableArtifact> generateDistributableArtifacts(EnvironmentConfiguration environment)
                                                              throws MalformedURLException
        Getting the processed artifacts of the project. The artifact list is calculated each time when the function is called therefore the developer should not call it inside an iteration.
        Returns:
        The list of dependencies that are OSGI bundles but do not have the scope "provided"
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - if the URL for the artifact is broken.

      • getEnvironmentsToProcess

        protected EnvironmentConfiguration[] getEnvironmentsToProcess()
        Getting an array of the environment configurations that should be processed based on the value of the environmentId parameter. The value, that is returned, is calculated the first time the function is called.
        Returns:
        The array of environment ids that should be processed.

      • processArtifact

        public DistributableArtifact processArtifact(EnvironmentConfiguration environment,
                                    org.apache.maven.artifact.Artifact artifact)
        Checking if an artifact is an OSGI bundle. An artifact is an OSGI bundle if the MANIFEST.MF file inside contains a Bundle-SymbolicName.
        Parameters:
        artifact - The artifact that is checked.
        Returns:
        A DistributableArtifact with the Bundle-SymbolicName and a Bundle-Version. Bundle-Version comes from MANIFEST.MF but if Bundle-Version is not available there the default 0.0.0 version is provided.

      • readDefaultFrameworkPops

        protected Properties readDefaultFrameworkPops()
                                       throws IOException
        Reading up the content of each /META-INF/eosgi-frameworks.properties file from the classpath of the plugin.
        Returns:
        The merged properties file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a read error occurs.

      • resolveDistPackageId

        protected String[] resolveDistPackageId(EnvironmentConfiguration environment)
                                 throws IOException,
                                        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
        Returns:
        A three length string array that contains the groupId, artifactId and version of the dist package.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the resrources of the default framework id configurations cannot be read.
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException - if the distPackage expression configured for this plugin has wrong format.
